Authors:
Anusha Hasini Ekanayaka, Qi Zhao, GARETH JONES, Kevin D
Hyde
Title: Genus Acervus extends their existence in China
Abstract:
Acervus is a small genus in Pyronemataceae. Most of the
species in this genus have been recorded from China. In the present
study, four collections of Acervus in Yunnan province, southwestern
China were investigated using morphology and DNA sequence data. This
paper provides detailed morphological descriptions of the sexual morphs
of A. stipitatus sp. nov. and A. globulosus sp. nov. with morphological
comparison of other closely related taxa. Multi-gene phylogenetic
analyses inferred from 28S, TEF1 and RPB2 sequence data strongly
supported lineages corresponding to morphological features. We also
provide a summarized comparison of the major morphological characters of
Acervus species.
